snippet: Eugene Kaspersky, the founder of Europe's largest antivirus company, is using his company's integral role in exposing or decrypting computer viruses aimed at Iran to argue for an international treaty banning computer warfare, Andrew E. Kramer and...
abstract: Eugene Kaspersky, the founder of Europe's largest antivirus company, is using his company's integral role in exposing or decrypting computer viruses aimed at Iran to argue for an international treaty banning computer warfare, Andrew E. Kramer and Nicole Perlroth report in Monday's New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: Discoverer of Flame Virus Backs Ban on Computer Warfare
